component.name: Eden
component.summary: Open-source Switch emulator for high-performance gaming

description.p: Eden is an open-source emulator for the Switch, crafted to deliver exceptional performance and stability across Windows, Linux, and Android platforms, with macOS support planned. Built in C++ as a fork of the Yuzu emulator, Eden enables users to enjoy Switch games on diverse devices, optimized for both casual gamers and emulation enthusiasts.

Launched on May 10, 2025, Eden leverages a Vulkan 1.4 renderer to achieve high frame rates, with titles like The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild exceeding 100 FPS on capable hardware. Its mobile-first interface offers intuitive navigation, customizable controls, and per-game profiles, ensuring accessibility for all users. Eden supports a growing library of games, including Super Mario Odyssey and Animal Crossing: New Horizons, as listed on its official compatibility page.

As a community-driven project, Eden thrives on contributions via its Git repository and Discord community. Regular updates, including bug fixes and performance enhancements, reflect its active development. This AppBundle/AppImage release provides a portable, standalone solution for Linux users.
Eden is legally compliant, requiring users to provide their own game dumps and keys.

item.p: CPU: AMD64 with FMA or ARM64-v8a, 6+ threads (e.g., Intel Core i5-4430, AMD Ryzen 3 1200, or Qualcomm Snapdragon 460)
GPU: OpenGL 4.6 or Vulkan 1.1 compatible (e.g., NVIDIA GeForce GT 1050 4GB or AMD Radeon R7 240 4GB)
Storage: 10GB free space for emulator and game dumps
A comprehensive table of minimum system requirements is available at https://eden-emu.dev/compatibility.html
Dependencies: None. The "Light" AppImage release may require you to have specific firmware installed in your system
